text: SUPER: “1981” Two eager and anxious 10-year-olds make their way up the to the front steps. Meet skinny CHARLIE KAGAN, and his be friend, the portly STU KLAMINSKY. They each carry gifts. Charlie’s present is meticulously wrapped with bow and ribbon... Stu’s is cobbled together newspaper and duct tape. sTU (excited) Seven minutes in heaven! What could be better than seven minutes in heaven?
Eight minutes in heaven? (off Stu’s look) What? sTU Try not to embarrass me, okay?
(grabs his friend’s arm) Wait, Stuey, run it by me again... (cramming) Second base is boob. Inside or outside the shirt?
Inside, man. And third base is finger!
Finger?
Or thumb.
I should have written this down. (head spinning) Boob, finger, thumb... so, what the heck is first base?
Kissing.
So I’ve gone to first base with my Mom?
Tongue kissing.

Oh, okay, got it. And a home run? (Stu gives him a look) Duh, I know what a home run is. (then) Anything else I need to know? sTU An intentional walk is a kiss on the cheek. Rain delay is when grown-ups interrupt you in the middle of your game. And an inside the park home run is a blowjob. They arrive on the doorstep.
What’s a blowjob?

(without missing a beat as he rings the bell) I have no idea. But I overheard my dad saying that he gets one once a year on his birthday so it must be good. BRITTA COOKSEY, a prepubescent peach, opens the door.
Happy birthday, Britta.
(pleased) Hi, Charlie. (flat) stu. (sultry smile) c’mon, party’s downstairs... in the basement. She winks conspiratorially. Off Charlie and Stu’s look...

OLIVIA NEWTON-JOHN moans the lyrics to “Physical” as we g CLOSE ON A SPINNING BOTTLE. PULL OUT as the bottle slows and comes to a stop, pointin a little blonde pixie named JENNIFER. Stu throws up his hands in triumph! The PARTY-GOERS shriek with glee.

You. Me. Closet. Seven minutes. Heaven. Jennifer looks like she just received a death sentence. A she and Stu walk toward the closet, we catch Charlie eyei the birthday girl in rhapsody. He awkwardly smiles at her. We RACK-FOCUS to discover another little girl catching the look. She’s a GOTH GIRL outcast and hasn’t taken her eyes off Charlie all evening She just STARES while fingering a Wicca-style pentagram necklace that hangs around her neck. It’s a little creepy A couple of the school-kids snicker and LOCK Stu and Jenn inside the closet.
Stu starts to saunter over to Jennifer, attempting his be James Dean (but coming off more like Porky Pig).
Stop. (opening the negotiation) Okay, I’1l tell everybody we kissed if you stand on that side of the closet and don’t touch me.
Deal. If you say we did the nasty.
I’ll say you touched my breasts.
Say I touched you “down there”.
I’'1l say you touched me “down there”... but over my pants.  sTU Deal. Pleasure doing business with you. They both sit on opposite sides of the closet and wait fo time to expire.

location: SIX AND A HALF MINUTES LATER 4

text: CLOSE ON A BOTTLE -- a little hand comes into frame and g it. PULL BACK to REVEAL that it’s Charlie’s turn to spin. He looks around the circle, zeroing in on Britta.
Wait. Stu pulls Charlie aside and whispers to him. STU (cont'd) Who are you aiming for?
(swooning) The birthday girl. sTU You take wind speed into account? Charlie glances up to see the spinning ceiling fan. He no
Wind speed, contour of the bottle, friction resistance... (then) How did it go with Jennifer?

Blowjob. I/’11 tell you about it later. The boys head back to the circle and Charlie carefully SP THE BOTTLE. It turns. And turns. And turns. Slowing as it reaches Britta Cooksey. Yes. Closer. Closer. Nooooooooo!!!!! It just misses her and spins past. And POINTS DIRECTLY at the GOTH GIRL. Charlie smiles uncomfortably. She just STARES...
We hear the terrifying CLICK of the DOOR LOCKING behind t as Bauhaus’ “Bela Lugosi’s Dead” plays. The Goth Girl stares at Charlie.
Stop staring. You’re freaking me out.
I’m looking at you ‘cause I like you, Charlie. It’s okay. C’mon. You can do what you want.
That's okay. I’m kind of... new at this. (awkward shrug) Rookie. (awkward beat) That’s a baseball term.

(abrupt) Let me see your penis. Charlie starts to stumble back as Goth Girl approaches. GOTH GIRL (cont'd) What’s the matter? Don’t you want me? She PULLS OFF HER SHIRT, revealing a LEATHER TRAINING BRA
(loudly) Oh, my God!
Outside the door, the kids listen with amusement.
That was quick...
Goth Girl is all over him now. Kissing him.
Wait, I can’t breathe. He pushes her off. BLACK LIPSTICK SMEARED ALL OVER HIS FA
I love you, Charlie. I’ve loved you since third grade.
You’re scaring me. Charlie stumbles back. Pulling himself up on clothes hang in the closet.
So you like to play hard to get? She rips his shirt open.
Back off!

I read in my Mom’s Cosmo... this is supposed to increase pleasure... She pounces, her FINGERNAILS scrape down his chest. He SCREAMS in pain, trying to crawl from under her. GOTH GIRL (cont'd) Don’t worry, this is my first time, too.
First time what? Killing?
No, silly. Making love. Now relax. She awkwardly TWISTS HIS NIPPLES. Charlie screams.
Ow! You freak!! He bucks her off him and RUNS at the closet door, BREAKIN THROUGH THE SHUTTERED PANELS.
Charlie falls to the ground, surrounded by kids looking o shocked amusement. The Goth Girl steps out and angrily glares at him.
Charlie Kagan, you are not my boyfriend anymore.
We interrupt this news report to bring you the following information -- no duhi Goth Girl stands above Charlie, who struggles to stand.
I hex you!
You what?
I hex you. You will never be happy!
Right on. Turn him into a toad! The Goth Girl spins on Charlie, possessed. She spits a cu at him.
(possessed) Around you love will fall like rain, but you shan't hold it - your heart will pain. Once the girl has been with you, to the next she will be true.

Is that Phil Collins? Charlie is finally standing, but Goth Girl PUSHES HIM BAC INTO THE CLOSET AGAIN AND EXITS. STORAGE BOXES rain on top of Charlie. Stu rushes into the closet and looks down at the still-terrified Charlie.  STU (cont'd) What happened? Did you thumb her? off Charlie’s scarred-for-life look, we...

The ocean water shimmers in the moonlight. Two lovers kis passionately by the shore. SUPER: “Present” REVEAL CHARLIE (now 30s) and CAROL, his current girlfrien Charlie has a boyish charm and an infectious grin. He’s t kind of friend who would donate his liver so you could ha another drink. Charlie pulls up for air.
You're amazing.
(mischievous ) Now, Charlie... are you just trying to get me into bed?

Forget bed. I’m trying to get you into sand. She leans back and pulls him down onto the wet beach. Clothes are torn off. Both are completely naked. It’s the NC-17 version of “From Here to Eternity”. CHARLIE (cont’d) Um... this is a public beach. Carol disappears below frame. Charlie moans. CHARLIE (cont’d) Oh, my God... Carol.
I love you. Charlie is silent. She repeats it, in case he didn’t hear CAROL (cont'd) I love you.  Charlie doesn’t respond. Carol surfaces. CAROL (cont'd) I love you, Charlie.
That's... nice.
That's “nice”?! I’m licking sand off your balls and you say, “that’s nice”?
No, I said “Oh, my God” about that. Believe me, it was a very enthusiastic “Oh, my God”. Carol stands up and grabs her clothes. CHARLIE (cont’d) I love... that you love me.
That’s pathetic. Carol starts to walk away. Charlie covers his groin with shirt and chases her down the beach.
Wait, I feel very strongly for you. She keeps walking, faster now. He stumbles behind. CHARLIE (cont'd) I’m sorry, I just don’t think the “L” word should be thrown around casually, that’s all.
The “L” word. What are you, eight?
“Love.” Okay, “love.” It shouldn’t be bandied about.

How about the “F” word? And the “U" word? Without looking back, she walks away down the beach.  10 11 10. Defeated, Charlie walks back to the spot where they undressed. He looks for his pants -- but they have WASHED AWAY in th waves.

A soaking wet Charlie, still holding his shirt over himse approaches his car in the empty parking lot. LOCKED! Damn. As he plays with the door, a SIREN WHIRS and LIGHTS FLASH police car stops in front of him. A BUTCH FEMALE POLICE OFFICER gets out of the car and calls to him over the loudspeaker.
Put your hands up where I can see them. Charlie awkwardly starts to raise his hands (and the shir covering himself). POLICE OFFICER (lOUDSPEAKER) (cont'd) Down! Put your hands back down!

Charlie and STU (now 30s) grab drinks from a coffee cart the pharmacy of Charlie’s building. Stu has become a plastic surgeon. He was a nerd as a kid, and success has now made Stu a nerd with too much money. He has a little dried blood on his jacket.
You going to Katie’s wedding next week?
Do bridesmaids give head in the coat room? Do you know how easy it is to score at a wedding?
Have you ever scored at a wedding?  11. sTU (defensive) I’m pacing myself. (then) Hey, is it weird that you were dating Katie six months ago and now she’s marrying a doctor.
I'ma doctor. sTU He’s a heart surgeon; you’re a dentist. It’s like saying General Patton and Colonel Mustard are both military men.
I'm thinking that this might be the last conversation we ever have. So if there’s anything you want to tell me, now is definitely the time.
Your mother sucks a mean cock. (without missing a beat) You going to the wedding with Carol?
Nah. We broke up three weeks ago.
Why didn’t you tell me?
I did. Three times.
She was so into you, man.
Yeah, I just-- I don’t know what’s wrong with me. I want love. I want to fall in love, but...
Chuck, love is not a four letter word.  12 12.
Actually, it is. (changing the subject; re: Stu’s clothes) Why are you always spackled in blood?
Hey, breast reconstruction is a messy job. THEY STEP INTO THE ELEVATOR to head up to their offices.
(thoughtful) Does seeing breasts every day... you know...
That's disgusting. I’1l have you know that I’m a professional. A beat. Then, unable to hold it, STU LAUGHS LOUDLY. The doors close on him laughing.

They get out of the elevator and move to their separate offices. Stu’s sign reads: “DR. STUART KLAMINSKY -- RECONSTRUCTIVE SURGERY”. Charlie’s reads: “DR. CHARLES KAGAN; DDS”. The two best friends are literally across th hallway from each other. A GIGANTICALLY BUXOM BLONDE approaches Stu’s office.
Hi, Dr. Stu. She disappears inside.
(sly whisper) I’ve jerked off to her X-rays.

I hope you find the time to write to me from Hell. Just then, a LARGE BLACK WOMAN (imagine if Queen Latifah Oprah) opens Charlie’s door from the inside. This is REBA his office manager/secretary.  13 13.

Dr. Charlie, you’re five minutes late. You’ve got four fillings, three cleanings, two crowns, and a canal. You've got too many patients and I’ve got too little patience for you to be gabbing gossip with Dr. Boobjobs in the hallway.
Hi, Reba, nice to see you. Reba doesn’t acknowledge him. She starts back in, but suddenly spins on Stu.
Were you just looking at my tits?
What? No.

Because I am more than happy with what the Lord Almighty gave me. And if you don’t want me to squash you like the bug that you are-- sTU (actually scared) I promise. I wasn’t looking at-- Reba holds up a finger, silencing him. Temporarily satisfied, she walks back in the office, dragging Charlie back inside with her.
Charlie washes his hands as his DENTAL INTERN hovers over beautiful patient, TRACEY, with the suction.

Hi, I’m Charlie. Tracey gurgles a greeting. Charlie rolls over in his chai and gently adjusts his assistant’s technique. CHARLIE (cont'd) Easy with the suction there. We want saliva, not her spleen. Charlie smiles warmly down at Tracey and takes over.  14 14. CHARLIE (cont’d) So, you lost a cap?
Chewing ice. (boldly flirty) My shrink says I have an oral fixation.
(amiably evasive) My shrink says I need to stop dating my patients.
Sounds like we both need to fire our shrinks. off her suggestive smile, we...

INT. TRACEY’S APARTMENT - MORNING 14 Charlie and Tracey are in the throws of a sweaty and deafening love-making session. She is yelling so loudly t it’s becoming embarrassing. Charlie tries to inconspicuou cover his ears with his pillow. A car alarm goes off outs Finally, the locomotive reaches the station and the two a silent in bed for a few moments.
My ears are ringing. Beat.
I’ve been dishonest with you.
You faked it?
Yes, but that’s not what I’m talking about. Charlie sits up. “Huh?” TRACEY (cont'd) I sought you out. Last week. (off his confused look) (MORE)
TRACEY (cont’d) I work at the hospital and you dated two of my friends. Amy from Radiology and Penny from Trauma.
I didn’t realize that they were such big fans. Well, I hope we last longer than I did with them.
Yeah, about that... I’m afraid this is it. Charlie takes this in. He is genuinely hurt.
Wow... I must really suck.
No, you were good. Really.
Is that why you faked it?

Sorry. Force of habit. Unlucky in love, I guess. (off his doe-eyed face) You want to give it another shot? Charlie, still taken aback, offers up a dispirited shrug. She kisses and gently snuggles into him.
So... how are the girls?
Married.
Both of them? (she nods) I dated Penny like last year.
(nodding) She met some Prince while vacationing in Cabo.
Jeez, feels like everybody is getting married. (suddenly panicked) (MORE)
15 16. CHARLIE (cont'd) You’re still my date for the wedding, aren’t you? I really don’t want to show up at my old girlfriend's wedding flying solo.
(playful nod) But only because I broke your heart. He smiles, partially placated.
(trying to gain face) I think it’s only fair to let you know... I faked it, too.

The reception is in full swing. Drinking, dancing, eating An EIGHTY-YEAR-OLD WOMAN finishes off a gut-wrenchingly horrific rendition of “Oops, I Did it Again” before the cheesy D.J. cuts her off. D.Jd. Thank you, Grandma Loretta. Up next we have Uncle Murray singing “Darling Nikki”. Yes... it is a KARAOKE WEDDING -- God help us all! In the far corner (furthest from the speakers), Stu hover next to Charlie.

Listen, you’re my wing-man. If the blonde asks, I’m a multi- billionaire who invented ketchup. If it’s the redhead, I wrote “We Are the World”. And if it’s that cheerleader hottie, my penis is in the Guinness Book of World Records. Girth, not length... I want it to sound believable. Charlie nods without listening. He’s too busy watching Tracey chat it up with the BEST MAN. A BEAUTY in a bridesmaid dress walks by. Stu smiles. STU (cont’d) Batter up!  17. He follows her off, as the bride, KATIE, sidles up next t Charlie. She kisses him on the cheek as Uncle Murray grinds the stage floor.
You look great.
So do you. (looking around) Seeing anyone? Charlie points toward Tracey in the corner.

We're getting serious. Katie looks over just as Tracey inhales the Best Man’s tongue. CHARLIE (cont’d) (backpedaling) And at the same time, we try to give each other our space. Katie looks at Charlie, sadly.
I worry about you sometimes, Chuck. Always a bridesmaid, never a bride.
It's probably best. White makes my calves look thick.
(touching his hand) Joke all you want. “The door to the human heart can only be opened from the inside.” (off his look) Dorky, definitely. But also true.
How about “It’s better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.”
I’1l buy that when you can honestly told me that you have loved.  16 18.
(nods ) Touche’.

I just want to see you happy, Chuckles. ON STAGE -- Uncle Murray throws out his hip. As he’s help off the stage, the D.J. amps up the crowd. D.d. Attention Hot Mamas! If we could have all the single ladies out on the dance floor for the tossing of the bride’s bouquet. Charlie watches on, amused. He notices that his Tracey is still in the far corner, flirting with the Best Man. He looks a little hurt. A DRUM-ROLL starts as Katie teases all the single ladies the bouquet. D.J. (cont’d) And the next lucky lady is... Katie throws the bouquet high in the air. A few of kids jump for them -- the flailing hands KNOCKIN THE FLOWERS BACK INTO THE AIR. The bouquet flies up and h a revolving fan in the ceiling, shooting the bundle DIREC INTO THE HANDS OF TRACEY. Surprised, she holds them up.

The party has calmed and dinner is almost digested. Charl sits at a table with several PRETTY, SINGLE GIRLS. A coup of chairs are vacant -- including the one for his date, w is nowhere to be found. ON STAGE -- an eight-year-old FLOWER GIRL sings “Brick Ho in the key of “Q”. Charlie and one of the women are in mid-conversation.

I’d rather have a twelve-hour colonoscopy than get my teeth cleaned. I hate dentists.  19. Charlie attempts his best friendly smile. At the other en of the room (and not a minute too soon), there is a CLINK GLASS -- all eyes look to the head table. Katie STANDS and addresses her friends and family.

I just want to thank everybody for coming to share this day with us. (looking to her husband) Hans, you make my heart soar. I couldn’t imagine being happier than I am right now. A GROOMSMAN calls out from the table...
Wait till tonight, sweetheart. The crowd chuckles. Katie raises her glass.

I know it’s a little unorthodox but I'd also like to propose a toast. To Charlie Kagan. Charlie is surprised to hear his name called. Katie winks him. KATIE (cont’d) Thank you, Charlie, for being my lucky charm. There is a confused smattering of applause as everyone drinks: “To Charlie”. Charlie doesn’t drink, trying to figure out what the hell she’s talking about. One of the girls at his table looks him with interest.
You’re that Charlie?
What Charlie?
(covering) That Charlie that’s a... dentist. Charlie gives her a “huh” look. WE SEE Pretty Girl #2 whispering to #3. In response, she CHORTLES out loud.  20.

Yeah, right! What-ever. Charlie gives them all a look -- something is weird. SUDDENLY, directly behind Charlie, A BUSBOY and A GUEST collide. CRASH! A flying wine bottle almost decapitates him. Charlie looks up to find CAMERON WEXLER -- perky, cute an klutz in the most adorable sense. She now wears a fair amount of RED WINE on her WHITE JACKET.

(without missing a beat) Table five? Charlie nods and offers her his napkin to dry her jacket. Cameron embarrassingly mouths “thank you” and sits. CAMERON (cont'd) (to Charlie; touch of irony) So, did I miss anything? As she hears the answer, she busies herself by crossing o the “ERON” on her table name card.

Let’s see: to have and to hold, love, respect, I do, I do, you may kiss the bride, chicken or fish, the first dance to a rendition of “I Will Always Love You” that was just plain wrong, white cake, raspberry filling, champagne, and... that’s about it. Cam turns and accidentally knocks her fork on the floor. picks it up and blows on it, dusting it off. The Karaoke kicks in again making it almost impossible to hear the rest of the table. But they don’t seem to mind.
I’m Cam. I went to college with the bride.
Charlie. Used to date the bride.  21.

Me, too. (the table blanches) Well, it was a one-time only experimental thing in college. And the experiment went horribly awry. (a sip of champagne) We couldn't stop giggling. Cam looks Charlie over. CAM (cont ’d) You're not really her type.
I was thinking the same about you.
Oh, the lesbian thing didn’t take. Now I only giggle with boys. (then) You gonna eat that? Charlie shakes his head and pushes his untouched piece of wedding cake toward her.
So, who are you here with?
No one. (mock offense) What are you trying to say?
Please, my date went home with the best man. (off her look) What do you do?
I run the penguin habitat at Sea World.
Seriously?
No. I’m a serial killer and my M.O. is that I kill people with my kung-fu grip. (off Charlie’s smile) What do you do?  22.
Dentist. Not quite as intriguing as “serial killer”. He deftly slides her his card.

(off the card) Well, at least you get these. We homicidal maniacs don’t usually carry business cards. She finishes off the last bite of his cake, then reaches Tracey’s uneaten slice. As she leans over, she accidental DUMPS a LARGE BOWL OF WATER FILLED WITH FLOATING CANDLES Charlie's lap. He JUMPS BACK, in PAIN from the liquid wax
(jumping around) Ahhh. Hot. Cold. Hot. Cold.

I am SO sorry. Thoroughly embarrassed, Cam helps Charlie clean up the me They both sit down -- Charlie squishing into his chair. Awkward moment. A little smile comes over Cam’s face. CAM (cont ‘d) The way you just reacted to that... it totally reminded me of someone. (searching her mind) I can’t place it. It’s right there on the tip of my tongue. (then) Oh, yeah, now I remember... (off his skeptical look) -..a six-year-old girl. Charlie nods a “thank you”, taking the dig like a man. St walks right over to Cam, cockily grinning from ear to ear
Well, here I am... what are your other two wishes?

(awkward aside) Um... If you hadn’t noticed, I was in the middle of flirting with Ms. Wexler.  23. sTU If you hadn’t noticed, she dumped a centerpiece in your lap. Take the hint. (turning to Cam) Hi, I’m Dr. Stuart Klaminsky. But you can call me Dr. Stu. (seeing her wine stain) You know, club soda and salt will get that out. Charlie continues the introduction...
Cam, Stu. Stu, Cam. (to Cam) Stu knows about stains because he’s always covered in blood.
You a serial killer, too? sTU Reconstructive surgeon. (false modesty) If someone has an accident or was born with a deformity, I’m there to help.
And by deformity, he means “small breasts”.
(to Cam) He’s jealous because he cleans plaque all day while I’m making the world a better place.
Because God knows, what this world needs is another stripper with boobs bigger than her head. (turning to Cam) Would you like to dance?
(teasing; re: Stu) It looks like your dance card is already full.
Maybe later?  17 18 24.

Sorry. It was nice meeting you... both. Cam waves to a good-looking man at another table and make quick exit. Charlie turns on Stu with a “what the hell is wrong with you” look. But he ignores it, looking up at th other women at the table.
Hey, are you ladies familiar with the Guinness Book of World Records? The cheesy KARAOKE SONG being sung on stage cross-—dissol into a cheesy elevator MUSAK rendition, as we... Cur TO:
Charlie strides into work. As he ENTERS his lobby, he see dozen or so women waiting. UPON CLOSER INSPECTION he notices that two of them are fr his wedding table. What the hell?!?

Good morning, Doctor. I think I have a cavity. Pretty Girl #2 shrugs, “Me, too.” As he walks slowly toward his office, we see that many mo of the women are vaguely familiar -- most were guests at wedding. INT. STU’S OFFICE - LATER 18 Charlie enters Stu’s waiting room and approaches the desk
Hi, Sharon. I need to see Stu right away! FROM THE BACK, we hear Stu...
Yo, Chuck. Come back here for a sec.  19 20 25. Charlie heads toward the examination room. As we follow h we see a quick glimpse of MICKEY ROURKE in the waiting ro
Charlie walks into a room with Stu and a TOPLESS BLONDE W GIGANTIC FAKE BREASTS. Charlie starts to step out of the room.
I’m sorry. I... sTU Wait-wait. We need you. Charlie, this is Pleasure. Charlie tries to avert his eyes while shaking her hand.
Nice to meet you.
The pleasure’s all mine. (then) Get it? The “pleasure” is all mine. My name is Pleasure.
(lost for words) It’s very... clever.
We're looking for a second opinion. What do you think? Are they even? Embarrassed, Charlie looks over at the mammoth mammaries. They are obscenely large... but even.
Walk-and-talk through the streets of San Diego’s historic Light District. Stu and Charlie munch on hot-dogs.
(confused) So you knew they were even?  26. sTU Of course they were even -- I did ‘em. I just wanted you to see ‘em without buying a lap dance.
How did you get a license to practice medicine?
(playing along) “License”? What do you mean? You need a license? Charlie moves toward Stu conspiratorially.
Listen... Have you noticed anything different about me?
Other than your aversion to women’s breasts?
I don’t have a... No, I just... women seem to be coming onto me... in an unusual way.

Well, somebody’s had a full cup of himself today. Stu looks over Charlie’s shoulder to see CAROL STANDING I SHOP, WEARING A WEDDING GOWN! She sees the gawking twosom and steps outside to greet them. She looks much happier than she did while she was ditchin Charlie on the beach.
Charlie. Stuart.
Carol?
(re: wedding dress) Are those back in season again? Carol holds out her hand to display a MASSIVE ENGAGEMENT RING. Charlie stares at Carol, confused.  21 27.
You're getting married? (she nods) We broke up like a month ago.

His name is Renaldo. We just clicked. What can I say? (she smiles at him) I guess you are a lucky charm. We go CLOSE ON Charlie as he gets a look of confusion... INT. CHARLIE’S PACIFIC BEACH HOUSE - EVENING 21 Charlie walks in the door from work, throws his white coa over a chair and walks to his answering machine. He presses the button.
You have fourteen new messages. (then) Message one...

Hey Charlie, my name is Randi Berenfeld. You don’t know me, but I got your number from Amy in Radiology. I was wondering if we could meet for drinks one of these nights. Charlie presses the button, skipping ahead. WOMAN’S VOICE (ON MACHINE) (cont'd) Hi Charlie, my name is Sheila. I was wondering if you were free... (presses button again) Hello Charlie, this is Gwen. (presses button again) Hi. It’s Sarah. (again) Hi, my name is Diane... Charlie hits PAUSE on the machine and sits, stunned.  22 28.

CLOSE ON -- a bucket of fish. Cam, dressed in sweats and water-proof boots, dumps the bucket into a tank of swimmi PENGUINS. There are literally hundreds of them; playing, waddling, skidding down a slide into the water. She picks up another pail and scatters it to the straggle

(to a penguin) Hey, Grumpy. Stop that. Leave Jester alone. She throws a dead fish for Jester in the back. Cam reache for another bucket -- but there is none. CAM (cont ‘d) (calling out) Joe?! Shift it into high gear, will ya? I want to go home. JOE appears, carrying two buckets of fish. Meet Cam’s sullen, lethargic little brother. He looks to be moving i slow motion. A professional pothead, Joe is always one to behind any conversation. He wears a T-shirt with WOODY HARRELSON on the front. CAM (cont‘d) Did you get lost back there?
Sorry. Smoke break.
You know if they catch you with weed, you’re gonna get fired. It doesn’t matter that you’re my brother.
Re-lax. How is anybody gonna know?
Maybe the hemp pants? Or the hemp shirt? Or the fact that you smell like you showered in bong water? Joe holds out the buckets of herring for her.  23 pt 29.
(reminiscent) When I was in college, I made a bong out of a dried blow-fish.
You never went to college.

Well, I never enrolled. But I sold a ton of shit at Stanford. Cam playfully throws a fish at him and finishes dumping t last bucket into the water. As she turns, she accidentall trips on the SECOND BUCKET. Cam TUMBLES on the top of the PENGUIN SLIDE and starts to SLIP DOWN the chute -- arms flapping, holding fish. She saves herself at the last moment, standing on the edge of ice. Whew!!! JOE (cont‘d) (chortling) And you think I look wasted? At the top of the slide, Cam looks up to see a Penguin ey the fish in her hands. Her smile fades.

Wait, Grumpy, no... Too late -- Grumpy dives down the slide and BOWLING BALLS into Cam. Her feet flip out from under her and she does a FACE PLANT against the rock and SINKS INTO THE WATER. The accident is half-tragic/half-hysterical. Joe rushes ( fast as a stoned stoner can rush) to the edge of the wate
Whoa, Murphy, that was radical. Cam surfaces holding her mouth.

I think I chipped a tooth. INT. CHARLIE’S CLASSIC CONVERTIBLE T-BIRD - NIGHT 23 pt The car door opens and a pretty young thing named NICOLE down in the passenger seat demurely. She dolls herself up Charlie walks around the car. The TOP IS DOWN.  30. The driver’s side door opens and Charlie SITS. A beat.
Do these seats go down?
Pardon? But she’s not waiting. She pounces, climbing over the sti shift and on top of him. Her butt accidentally JAMS INTO

CHARLIE (cont’d) On land, outside, they’re kind of awkward and goofy. That was a compliment?  CHARLIE (cont’d) But in the water, they’ve got this incredible grace and speed. They’re like God’s perfect creatures. Cam is touched. She doesn’t quite know what to say.
Okay.
Okay what?
Okay dinner.
Really?

Okay. 59. Then... Charlie gives a thumbs up to Joe, who now watches intentl from behind the glass in the penguin tank (arms crossed, shivering in the intense cold). Even the penguins who are flanking him look happy to hear the news. CAM (cont'd) But only as friends. If you have to know... I’m very serious about someone else.
You're dating someone?

Well, no. We haven’t exactly met... yet. She steps over and pulls a book off the shelf from the gi shop. All the books on the shelf topple to the ground. Sh acts as if it didn’t happen, turning the book over to sho Charlie the cover. A picture of the writer, HOWARD BLAINE CAM (cont'd) He’s the foremost expert on penguins in the world. I’1l be meeting him at a conference later this year.  51 60.

And I do not want to interfere with that. (a beat; then) Actually, I really, really want to interfere. But okay, a date. As friends. Just give me a chance, that’s all I’m asking for. She nods. They face each other silently for a moment.
What you said, about “God's perfect creature”... that was easily the nicest thing anyone has ever said to me.

(playful smile) I was exaggerating a bit. Cam grins and heads back off to work. She moves to open the door but it is LOCKED, ruining her perfect exit. Charlie hides his smile. She totters off in the other direction. INT. STU’S OFFICE - LATER 51 Stu is closing up shop as Charlie follows him around like excited puppy dog.
“Perfectly imperfect”? What the hell does that mean?
(searching) I don’t know. Haven’t you ever fallen for somebody’s flaws?
I’m a plastic surgeon. I see a flaw and I pour spackle over it. Charlie gets all warm thinking about her.
(goofy grin) She’s not very nice to me. (then) And she likes somebody else.  6l. sTU Score! Stu holds up a glass jar with some floating whitish-reddi gunk in it.
What is that?

(big smile) It’s what I’m gonna retire on, my friend. Stu opens a locked cabinet and places the jar on the shel next to two dozen other glass jars, filled with different looking artifacts. STU (cont'd) I’m gonna sell all this shit on Ebay for mad cash. Stu holds up a glass jar with two plastic implants in it. STU (cont’d) Pamela Lee's breast implants.
What? Why aren’t they implanted in her breasts? sTU She came in for a reduction. These are what I took out.
(incredulous) You saved them?
You know how much some sick dude is gonna pay for these? Holding up the bottle of whitish-reddish gunk. STU (cont'd) Mira Sorvino’s thigh fat.
Get out of here!  62. sTU I’m serious. It’s the cellulite from her left, inner thigh.
That’s disgusting. (morbidly fascinated) What else do you have?

(pointing to each one) Jennifer Grey’s septum, Michael Douglas’ droopy eye-lid, Burt Reynolds’ neck skin, Joan Rivers, Joan Rivers, Joan Rivers, Tori Spelling’s nose shavings, and the coup de grace, Jennifer Connelly’s breast reduction.
It looks like Mira Sorvino’s inner thigh.
Don’t be stupid. That’s bona fide Jennifer Connelly boob. Stu closes and locks up the cabinet with great care. He brings the conversation back around again... STU (cont’d) So, Charlie’s got a crush?
It’s not a crush. I can’t explain it... but she’s the one. When I’m with her, I feel like the stars are all lined up.
So, since you’re out of play, you won’t mind if I call up some of your ex-girlfriends?

(irked) Can I just say, I’m an idiot for taking your advice. “Public service!” All I succeeded in doing by being with all those women is to push my soulmate further away.  52 63. sTU Might I remind you that you also got your axle greased a fair amount in the process.

What's sex without love? sTU (answering) Sex. It’s still sex. Jesus Christ, I’ve never met anyone so bummed to squirt out a little baby gravy. Charlie shoots him a look -- “don’t talk like that”. STU (cont'd) (dumbfounded) Have you even kissed this girl yet? (Charlie shakes his head) And you‘re going cold turkey for her?
If she wants me more like a Gentoo, then I’m going to be more like a Gentoo.
You lost me.
A Gentoo is a monogamous penguin.

Did you go off your meds? Charlie EXITS Stu’s office and walks through the waiting filled with beautiful buxom women -- but Charlie doesn’t notice. He just shrugs back to Stu with a goofy smile. As we follow him out (like in the earlier scene), we see quick glimpse of GARY BUSEY in the waiting room.
Cam and Charlie walk down the moonlit beach, focused more each other than the crashing waves and strolling lovers around them.  64.
Do sharks get cavities?
No.
You have no idea, do you? Charlie shakes his head, caught.
Isn’t the point of 100 questions to ask personal questions? To learn about the other person?
I’ve learned that you don’t know the average birth weight of an African Dik-Dik. I think that’s just important as you knowing my favorite food is soup. (then) Okay, your question.
Why penguins?
Why teeth?
My question. I asked first.
Lots of reasons. For one, you can’t help but smile when you see a penguin.
Another trait they share with you.

Their world, Antarctica, is beautiful. I go there once a year for research. Because of the Earth’s axis, there’s only one sunrise and one sunset a year. You don’t know beauty until you’ve seen a once-a-year sunset in Antarctica.  65.
(taking her in) I don’t know about that. She blushes a little. A nice moment.
And their rituals are fascinating.
Penguin rituals? Charlie’s cell phone RINGS. He silences it immediately. CHARLIE (cont’d) Sorry.

(nodding) Rituals. Like when a male penguin is sweet on a female, he goes on a long search across the beach to find the perfect pebble to offer her. He hunts everywhere to find it. Finally, he waddles over and presents the stone by placing it at her webbed feet. If she accepts his offer, they will be life-long mates.
Like an engagement ring?
(nodding) It’s unbelievable to watch. They quietly pass a couple of teenagers making out in the sand.
I have a feeling that you’re a very good kisser. I mean, I’ve already spent an hour and a half inside your mouth, so I should know.
(playful) What makes you think I’1l be kissing you? (then) (MORE)

53 54 55 66. CAM (cont'd) Might I remind you that with penguins, mate selection is up to the female. Cam, who’s been looking at Charlie, walks face first into wooden pier plank. She falls back to the sand.
(falling to his knees) You alright?
Ow. He leans in. He kisses her head. Cheek. They touch lips. Gentle. Soft. A perfect kiss. He pulls away slowly, and..

Yeah, maybe I was wrong about the “very good kisser” thing. She laughs loudly and tackles him into the sand. She star to walk away in mock offense. CHARLIE (cont’d) Hey, I’m sorry. Everybody has something they’re good at. I’m sure we'll find yours! He starts to chase her down, as we... MONTAGE -- Through a number of dates. -- They stand against the rail, watching the rippling wat as they snuggle aboard the Bahia Belle, a Mississippi-sty stern wheeler that cruises Mission Bay.
Okay, so fess up about this charm.
You know about it? (she nods; “of course”) And what do you think?

I think it’s a pretty creative way to get laid. -- Holding hands while walking through the Prado area in Balboa Park, taking in the sublime Spanish Moor Architect -- Picnicking on the grass in front of the gigantic bould torso of the BEAR SCULPTURE at UCSD.  56 57 58 67. -- Dining at Bertand’s at Mister A’s and watching the 56 cityscape from it’s panoramic view. She opens a beautiful wrapped gift. REVEAL that he’s bought her a “LO-JACK”. -- Finally, we find our two STOMPING GRAPES and making wi at the Julian Grape Stomp Fest. It’s only a matter of seconds before it turns into a dunking contest where both losers. This leads us to...

Charlie and Cam share a CARRIAGE RIDE in the beautiful to outside of San Diego that is nestled in the Cuyamaca Mountains. But they aren’t seeing any of it, making out like two sch kids in the back of the carriage. Charlie’s hands go for bra clasp. He fumbles around for what seems like an eternity.
First time? Charlie is shivering almost imperceptibly. It’s unclear i the cause is the crisp air or the moment.
With you, it almost feels like it. Her smile warms him. With a mischievous grin, Cam takes her bra off under her shirt. She holds it out for him.
I think you were looking for this. Charlie is speechless. In the blink of an eye, he’s Woody Allen.
So... you’re okay with... us... you know... getting a little more...
(frisky) Do I need to provide written instructions? Charlie quickly turns to the driver of the carriage:  68.
Um... we'll be getting off here.

(sotto; suggestively) Yes, you will. The two love-birds stumble out of the coach and immediate disappear into the nearby Cuyamaca park, already starting remove each other’s clothes. RING. His cell phone goes off. It’s a DIFFERENT SOUNDING RING this time...
This is not happening.
Turn it off.

It’s the emergency line. I’m sorry. (peeling her off of him) I promise, I‘ll make it fast. Charlie roots through his pants and finds the ringing cel phone. He moves away to answer it. CHARLIE (cont’d) Dr. Kagan speaking. INTERCUT STU IN HIS APARTMENT.
Dude... One word and Charlie already knows who it is.
This better be an emergency.
You're gonna want to hear this. Charlie looks over to Cam who is now stretched out on som rocks. Her hands aren’t waiting for Charlie to come back. She enjoys giving him a show.
I’m hanging up now.  69. sTU Wait. Have you boned her yet?
Goodbye.
Fine, if you wanna lose Cam forever, hang up the phone.
(taking the bait) What are you talking about? sTU That charm thing. Turns out it’s a curse. I’m telling you, you shake the sheets with Cam, she’s going to Marry the next person she dates!
We both know that’s bullshit. Twenty yards away, Cam moans.
(calling out; writhing) I hope there’s some left for you when you get back.
Yeah? Well I started calling your exes to take the Hummer on a little bush patrol, if you know what I mean. (then) And they’re married. Every single one you closed the deal with.
Impossible.

You'd think so, right? But you'd be wrong! A to Z on your palm pilot. Cathleen Alexander to Jeannie Zokovitch. All married. As he talks, Stu looks at the wedding announcements page the paper.  59 70. STU (cont'd) Even Tracey! The nurse! The girl you brought to Katie’s wedding? (loudly) She’s marrying the best man! The guy right after you! Charlie is speechless. Stu picks up a piece of paper from his couch and dusts away the pizza crumbs. STU (cont'd) And did you see this month’s high school newsletter. Kari Lizer.
What? The girl I lost my virginity to?

Did you see who she wound up marrying? Bobby Romanus. That douchebag she dumped you for. Charlie is silent. STU (cont'd) Are you there? Charlie turns back to see Cam standing on top of the rock TOTALLY NAKED and grinning ear to ear. She gives a playfu wave.
(sotto; into phone) I hate you. I really, really hate you.
Charlie pulls up out front. A long, awkward moment. Cam looks straight ahead, clearly too embarrassed to move.
Well... thanks.
I’m sorry. I should probably go. Dental emergency and all. Cam nods her head, disappointed and a little flustered.  60 71.
Yeah. (beat) I’ve never heard of somebody cracking fourteen teeth before.

(caught; vamping) Yeah... Freak industrial accident. (quickly; off Cam’s dubious look) I should really go. INT. CAM’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS 60 Joe sits on the couch with a bong watching “Teletubbies” surrounded with bags of empty potato chips. Beat. He giggles at the screen. Another beat. A LOUD CRASH as a brick is thrown in the front window by door. A hand UNLOCKS the door. Cam enters and plops down the couch next to him, looking disappointed.
Forgot your keys again? She nods, pulling her bra out of her pocket.
Didn’t know you were here.
(offering her a chip) How’d your date go?
It could have gone better. (vexed) He’s playing hard to get.
How are you playing it?
I dry-humped a hitching post in front of him. Cam sinks further into her chair and grabs the bag of Bug  61 72.
So, what’s the biggie? I thought you weren’t into this guy.
Me either. It’s just... the way he looks at me sometimes. When I’m around him, I feel like we’re the only ones there. You know?
(nods) I feel the same way around Mary. Jane.
Charlie and Stu walk past sun-tanning beauties and make t way across the concrete-paved den of skin.
You really want to go through with this?
(determined) I’ve got to be sure.
This is gonna get ugly.
I have to do it. I’ve got to put the curse to the test. (then) Where is she?

(pointing) She’s usually beached over there by that diving board. They start to walk toward the far side of the pool. They approach three people on a towel -- wait a minute -- that not three people -- it’s ONE! STU (cont’d) There she is. Eleanor Skepple.
And she’s single? (off Stu’s look) (MORE)
CHARLIE (cont'd) What? There’s somebody for everybody.

She’s here every day. Always ina two piece. In addition to the back acne, she’s got front acne and side acne. See the glass of water by her garbage bag of ding-dongs? She keeps her teeth in that glass. She’s grouchy, angry, rude, never tips and has more chest hair than Rin Tin Tin. A beat as Charlie considers this.
Is she my best bet?

Sink the soldier all you want, there's no way this chick is getting married. If she were the last woman on Earth, humanity would come to a screeching halt. Charlie takes a deep breath, then bravely proceeds. Charlie walks past a dozen HOT, HOT, HOT GIRLS in bikinis He stops by Eleanor Skepple. She glares up to him.
Hey asshole, you’re in my sun.
Hi. My name is Charlie. What’s your name?
Kate Moss. Now beat it.
I’m sorry, I was just wondering if I could take you out tonight. (nothing; beat) What do you say to that? Eleanor FARTS IN RESPONSE.
Would you like me to elaborate?  62 63 74.

No, I think I understand. I’m very sorry to bother you. Charlie starts to walk away, defeated. Then turns back. CHARLIE (cont’d) I’1l give you a hundred dollars to go on a date with me. She doesn’t respond. CHARLIE (cont’d) Two hundred dollars.
Eleanor and Charlie are on a date at the beautiful Hotel Coronado. Eleanor eats a lobster. Charlie has a dozen sho glasses in front of him -- half empty, half full.

A lucky charm, huh? He nods. Eleanor sucks the “green stuff” from her lobster Charlie throws back another shot, working up the courage. ELEANOR SKEPPLE (cont'd) And you just gotta take me out for dinner? Charlie downs another two shots. Here goes nothing...
(reluctantly) Well... I was kinda thinking we could... get physical.

Alright! I haven’t gotten any action since my last gyno exam. She flashes a hideous smile, green slime hanging from her teeth. Shot. Shot. Shot. INT. CHARLIE’S BATHROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT 63 Charlie is standing in his shower, scrubbing himself raw a soapy sponge. Thank God for JUMP CUTS.  64 65 66 67 68 75. He shuts off the water, breathing a sigh of relief.
And now... we wait. INT. CAM’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 64 Cam gets home and pushes the button on her answering mach

You have one new message. She smiles and pushes PLAY. CHARLIE’S VOICE (ON MACHINE) Hey Cam, I hope you had a nice day at work. (cough, cough) Listen. I’m sorry. But I’ve got this cough I can’t seem to shake. Think we can just talk tonight. On the phone. I’d really, really like that... Cam smiles. She’d like that, too. As we...

MUSIC UP: The EELS’ COVER OF THE RUTLES’ “I Must Be In Love”. TIME LAPSE of Charlie and Cam on the phone togethe as, separately, they watch T.V., cook dinner, drive in the car, lounge around the house, and iSight wit each other online. INTERCUT with this are shots from their personal lives. 6 Charlie continuing to work on patients, Cam in the Pengui Habitat (at one point video-taping the birds for research We also see Charlie actively trying to make himself “unavailable” to the many women who are still pursuing hi We see him slipping on a wedding ring before welcoming fe clients into the office. He puts out a PHOTOSHOPPED pictu of himself with a UNKNOWN BRIDE in his office to make it like he’s already married. We even see him camouflaging h appearance as he heads out to his car. All the while he and Cam enjoy each other’s phone company laughing, smiling and most of all, happy.  69 70 71 76. INT. STU’S OFFICE - THE NEXT DAY 69 Stu looks unhappier than we’ve ever seen him.
No way. No way, man.
You gotta do it. sTU Yeah, right! So I go out with Eleanor Skepple to test the curse and what happens next? I’m walking down the aisle with Shamu! I don’t think so.
I’‘1ll pay you.
I don’t need your money. I’ve got Mira Sorvino’s thigh fat. I’m going to be a wealthy man.

Come on, there’s got to be something I can offer you. Stu thinks for a moment. An idea... INT. CHARLIE’S OFFICE - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS 70 STU WALKS OUT FROM THE OFFICE. He wears a white jacket wi the name “Dr. Kagan” stitched onto the chest. He turns to the half-dozen waiting women.
(eagerly) Hello, ladies... I’m Dr. Kagan. Who's first?

Stu and Charlie stand by the shallow end. The diving boar in the distance. Stu screws up his courage and walks towa Eleanor.  72 77. Charlie’s P.O.V. -- from a distance, Charlie watches with satisfaction as Stu chats it up with Eleanor. INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE/CAM’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - NIGHT 72 Charlie and Cam are on the phone. They each soak in a bub bath. Completely pruned, it’s obvious that they have been talking for hours.
I can’t believe you’re still sick. How long has it been?
Almost two weeks. It’s killing me, but I don’t want to infect you.
At this point, I wouldn’t mind. (girly giggle) God, I feel like a kid again. I haven’t talked to someone on the phone this much since high school.
Which reminds me... what are you doing for prom?
I love your voice. The crazy thing is... I can’t picture you anymore.
I’m 6'2”, steely blue eyes, washboard abs.
Can I ask you something... Are you avoiding actually seeing me?
What? Are you kidding me? I’m dying to see you.
Come over. Right now. Wash my back. (silence) I’ll wear a mask. We can both wear masks. We'll play doctor.  78.
Oh, God, I want to so badly, but...

“But” nothing. I need to see you. I need to see if that birthmark you have really looks like Alfred Hitchcock. Charlie bites his tongue, not knowing what to say. CAM (cont ’d) Okay. If I can’t see you, maybe we could at least take our phone relationship to the next level.
What do you mean? She puts on a SEXY VOICE.
Mmmm, yeah. Oh, yeah. Do you like that?
Like what?
(out of character) That’s my phone sex voice. Work with me here. (sexy again) Sometimes when I’m out of batteries, I like to use my electric toothbrush.
Um, I don’t think this is a good idea. We probably shouldn’t do anything that feels like sex...
It’s just a little phone sex.

Eh, I don’t know if that’s against the-- Charlie HEARS A BUZZING SOUND coming from the phone...  73 79. CHARLIE (cont’d) (quickly) Ooops, other line. Gotta go. He hurriedly clicks OFF THE PHONE. Frustrated. The PHONE RINGS. He looks down at call waiting and quickl picks it up. CHARLIE (cont’d) Stuey. Talk to me. INTERCUT STU - who is placing a large grapefruit (with a penis-sized hole in it) into the microwave.

The deed is done. I went out with Eleanor. And I’m not proposing to her. So you’re in the clear. (then) Are you there? REVEAL Charlie’s phone sitting on the edge of the bathtub trail of water leading out the bathroom door. Gone!
EXT. CAM’S APARTMENT - A SHORT TIME LATER 73 Charlie is standing in front of Cam’s door. She opens it wearing sweats, surprised to see him there.
Hi.
I'm sorry I didn’t call. I couldn’t wait.
What happened to your cough?
(with a shrug) Devine intervention. I guess God just wants to see us have sex. Cam smiles.
Well, I hate to disappoint.  74 80. And with that, she pulls him inside...

Yes, we've arrived at the requisite “love making” montage between Charlie and Cam. MUSIC SWELLS as they start to ma love. Halfway through the scene, we see Cam detach a VIDEO CAME from its tripod and smile over to Charlie.

I think we need a well-documented historical record of this monumental occasion. How about you? Charlie nods like a puppy dog. Of course he’s game. -- Our couple takes turns with the camera as the scene continues to be beautifully shot and scored. Think “9 1/2 Weeks” meets “Red Shoe Diaries”. Back-lit. Primary colore lights wash over their gorgeous bodies. As the MUSIC FADES, we DISSOLVE to them in bed together. Snuggled in a stop-the-hands-of-time embrace. A poetic moment. Then... both of them rise up quickly with excitement.

I can’t wait any longer. Put in the tape. Put in the tape. Cam quickly attaches a cable to the T.V., jumps back into with the remote and presses PLAY. CLOSE ON THEIR FACES as they watch the screen. They each simultaneously tilt their heads to the side, trying to decipher the image. CAM (cont ‘d) Is that my nipple?
(shaking his head slowly) I think it’s a pimple on my back. After a moment, they both get a look of HORROR on their f and RUSH TO TURN OFF THE TAPE.  75 76 gl.

Turn it off, good God, turn We’ve made a terrible it off. mistake! INT. CAM’S BEDROOM - LATE NIGHT 75 Cam sleeps peacefully. Charlie next to her, gazing at her perfect face. Lit by the flicker of the television. A gentle moment. Then...

(without opening her eyes) Stop looking at me. You’re freakin’ me out. Charlie smiles warmly and rolls over. On the T.V., a LOCA NEWS PROGRAM is on. The CHYRON reads: “OBESITY IN AMERICA There are quick shots of FAT PEOPLE as a reporter talks t the camera (the sound muted). SUDDENLY, Charlie’s face fills with panic. He moves for t TIVO remote and hits PAUSE. REVERSE. BACK. BACK. BACK. STOP. On the SCREEN -- a PAUSED IMAGE that is clearly ELEANOR SKEPPLE -- KISSING A HEFTY MAN.
Oh, my God!!! INT. CAM’S APARTMENT - MOMENTS LATER 76
Charlie paces and whispers loudly into his phone.
Wake up! Wake up! Wake up! INTERCUT -- Stu picking up the phone in his bed.
(half-asleep) Hello?
(controlling his panic) “The deed is done!” “The deed is done!?!”  82. sTU It’s five o’clock in the morning. What are you talking about?
The deed. I’m talking about the deed. I thought you went out with Eleanor Skepple.
Naw, I just said that.
What?!? CAM’S VOICE (0.S.) (from the other room) Charlie? Is everything okay?
(shielding phone) Everything’s fine, sweetie. I’1l be back in a minute. (into phone; incredulous) You just “said that”?
I didn’t want to risk it. Marrying her.
I saw you with her! You asked her out!!!
No. I asked her what time it was. It was 3:52.
I can’t believe I trusted you. You are no longer my friend.
Can I still pretend to be you?
No. You can’t be me. I’mme. TI never want to talk to you again. Ever. Ever ever.
You're really going to let a girl come between us?  77 83.

Not a girl. The girl. (then; definitively) And now I’m going to lose her. Charlie slams down the phone as his words hang in the air He takes a deep breath. Shakes his head sadly and contemplates for a beat. The wheels start to turn in his head. Sadness turns to anger which turns to steely resolv He starts to psych himself up. CHARLIE (cont’d) (determined) No. I’m not going to lose her. PUSH INTO Charlie’s crazed eyes...
CLOSE ON Cam, who is sleeping soundly. A cup of coffee co into frame and is swirled about. A smile comes over her:

Mmmm... breakfast in bed. Her eyes open as we PULL OUT to REVEAL that it is TRULY BREAKFAST IN BED. The entire bed is filled with food. It looks like she woke up in the middle of the Bellagio buffet in Vegas. Scrambled eggs, omelettes, fried eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, toast, muffins, pancakes, waffl crepes, every imaginable kind of juice, etc. cam is taken aback.
Good morning.
Am I supposed to eat my way out?
I just thought you’d like a little breakfast.
(a little confused) Thank you.  78 84. She sits up (careful not to spill anything) and picks up piece of toast. She looks over to Charlie, who looks a little tweaked. CAM (cont‘d) Are you okay?
Couldn’t be happier. You okay? Cam nods. She studies him for a moment.
You’re acting kind of strange.
I’m not acting strange. He sits down on the edge of the bed, trying to look natur Cam just looks at him, “What the hell is going on?” CHARLIE (cont’d) So, what do you want to do today?
Well... I’ve got to go to work.
Right. Of course. Work. Me, too. (then) How about Saturday night? Or Sunday? Say Wednesday? Cam looks him over. What the hell?
Can we play it by ear?
Stu and Charlie brave the morning traffic to walk to work Charlie dials his cell phone and waits for an answer.
Hey, Cam. How’s it going? (then) I just wanted to make sure I had your right cell number. Got it. No worries. Everything’s cool. (beat) (MORE)

79 85. CHARLIE (INTO PHONE) (cont'd) And I’m looking forward to Saturday night. And Sunday. And Wednesday. Okay, bye. Charlie flips the phone off. Stu looks over to him, wanti to say something, but doesn’t. A beat later, Charlie flips the phone open again and dial CHARLIE (INTO PHONE) (cont’d) (acting surprised) Cam? Cam, is that you? Oh, my God, I must have dialed you instead by accident. I meant to call the... library. How funny is that? (then) Right. Work. Of course. Okay, bye. Charlie flips his phone off. He and Stu continue to walk silence. Charlie opens the phone again and dials. CHARLIE (INTO PHONE) (cont‘d) Hey, guess who? Listen, I just wanted to tell you that I won’t call again. So, if you need or want to talk to me, for whatever reason, you’ll have to call me. (then) No problem. Okay, this is it. My last... transmission. This call. Here. Bye. Bye. Bye. B-- Before Charlie finishes saying “Bye” again, Stu rips the phone out of his hand, drops it on the floor, and STOMPS IT AGGRESSIVELY. The phone shatters into a million pieces After a beat, Stu continues walking.

You’re welcome. INT. CAM’S WORK - PENGUIN HABITAT - AFTERNOON 79 Cam opens the door to her office to find the room FILLED A ZILLION FLOWERS. She wades through them to find a card. It reads: “Miss you already, Charlie”. A stoned Joe shuffles up behind her.  80 86.
(flat) Is there something different in here since lunch? Cam opens the closet to hang her jacket as HUNDREDS OF RE

head_text.subj: HELIUM BALLOONS ESCAPE FROM THE LITTLE ROOM AND FLOAT TO

text: Every single one of them is shaped like a HEART.

(softly) What the he-- There is a KNOCK ON THE DOOR. Cam goes to it. FOUR MEN IN TUXES STAND AT THE DOOR. One of them blows on a tuning harmonica and then, in perf harmony, they sing a barbershop quartet version of Beyonc “Crazy in Love”:

(singing) I look and stare so deep in your eyes. I touch on you more and more every time. When you leave I'm beggin’ you not to go. Call your name two, three times in a row. (they start lame choreography ) Got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Your love's got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Your touch's got me lookin’ so crazy right now. Joe and Cam just stare at the quartet in silence. Then...
Hey -- you guys do Free Bird?!

Cam makes her way toward her car. As she approaches, she slows, a look of dismay materializing on her face. PIVOT to REVEAL Cam’s car. Tin cans are tied to the back bumper and there are hearts and written in soap all over car. On the back window, a big sign reading: “ALMOST MARRIED".  81 82 87.
